Name: Eleanor Vance
History: CEA normalized from 12.5 to 4.2 following L2 transition.
Biology: Informational: EGFR exon 19 deletion is associated with potential sensitivity to 3rd-generation EGFR TKIs.

extended.rationale: Standard 1L systemic therapy initiated pending NGS results. Histology consistent with non-squamous disease.
extended.dosing: Carboplatin AUC 5 + Pemetrexed 500mg/m2 q3w x 4 cycles -> Maint Pemetrexed.
extended.toxicity: Course complicated by Grade 2 anemia requiring support. G1 fatigue persistent. No dose reductions.
extended.outcome: Achieved SD for 14 months. Progression marked by development of contralateral lung nodules while on maintenance.

extended.rationale: Transitioned to targeted therapy following identification of EGFR Exon 19 deletion on re-biopsy.
extended.toxicity: Grade 1 dry skin and paronychia, managed with topical steroids. Grade 2 diarrhea (intermittent).
extended.outcome: Deep Partial Response (PR) confirmed on Dec 2024 scans. Primary tumor volume reduced >50%.

report.findings: Patient presented with 3-week history of non-productive cough and trace hemoptysis. ECOG 0. Auscultation reveals diminished breath sounds in RUL.
report.impression: Suspicion of pulmonary malignancy vs tuberculosis. CXR confirms opacity.
report.plan: Referral to Pulmonology for CT Chest and bronchoscopy.

report.findings: CT Chest: 3.2cm spiculated mass RUL. 1.1cm Hilar lymph node. No distant mets. Biopsy: Adenocarcinoma, TTF-1 positive.
report.impression: Stage IIIA (T2a N1 M0) NSCLC. Unresectable due to hilar involvement.
report.plan: Initiate systemic chemotherapy (Carboplatin/Pemetrexed). Send NGS panel.

report.findings: Primary mass stable at 3.1cm (Prev 3.2cm). Hilar node stable. No new pulmonary nodules. Hepatic parenchyma clear.
report.plan: Continue maintenance Pemetrexed. Monitor renal function.

report.findings: Interval development of 3 new solid nodules in Left Lower Lobe (largest 9mm). Primary RUL mass increased to 4.2cm. Mild pleural effusion.
report.impression: Radiological Progression (PD). Conversion to Stage IVA.
report.plan: Discontinue Chemo. Re-biopsy for resistance mechanisms. Liquid biopsy sent.

report.findings: NGS confirms EGFR Exon 19 Deletion (Sensitizing). T790M Negative. PD-L1 75%.
report.impression: Targetable driver mutation identified. Candidate for 3rd gen TKI.
report.plan: Start Osimertinib 80mg QD. Monitor for QTc prolongation and diarrhea.

report.findings: Significant interval reduction in RUL mass (4.2cm -> 2.1cm). Contralateral nodules resolved or calcified. Effusion resolved.
report.impression: Partial Response (PR). Excellent tolerance to TKI.
report.plan: Continue Osimertinib. Next scan in 3 months.

Name: Arthur Morgan
History: Stable clinical state sustained for 14 months.
Gradual decline in renal markers identified.
Biology: Informational: High PD-L1 (90%) is a biological indicator associated with Pembrolizumab response.

extended.rationale: First-line monotherapy indicated for PD-L1 TPS > 50% (Patient 90%) in absence of driver mutations.
extended.toxicity: Grade 1 hypothyroidism (TSH elevated), started Levothyroxine. No pneumonitis or colitis.
extended.outcome: Durable Stable Disease (SD). Bone metastases sclerotic. Adrenal lesion stable.

report.findings: 4cm RUL mass abutting mediastinum. N2 disease confirmed via EBUS. Squamous histology.
report.impression: Locally advanced NSCLC. Poor surgical candidate due to COPD.
report.plan: Refer to Medical Oncology. Molecular testing pending.

report.findings: PET Scan: New FDG-avid lesion L3 vertebra (SUV 8.2) and Right Adrenal (3cm).
report.impression: Upstaging to IVB. Symptomatic back pain consistent with L3 met.
report.plan: Palliative RT to L3. Initiate Pembrolizumab (PD-L1 90%).

report.findings: Patient reports resolution of back pain post-RT. ECOG improving to 1. Adrenal met stable.
Primary lung mass stable at 3.8cm (cavitary changes). No new bone lesions. Renal function borderline (Cr 1.1).
report.impression: Durable SD. Renal decline likely comorbidity related.

report.findings: Thoracic disease unchanged. Adrenal lesion stable at 2.8cm. L3 sclerosis (healing). No new active lesions.

Name: Hazel Grace
Biology: Informational: ALK rearrangement is a biological target for CNS-penetrant TKIs like Alectinib.

extended.rationale: First-generation ALK inhibitor initiated at diagnosis of metastatic disease.
extended.toxicity: Visual disturbances (trails of light) noted initially, resolved. G1 Edema.
extended.outcome: Good systemic control for 2.5 years. Failure isolated to CNS (brain mets) due to poor BBB penetration.

extended.rationale: Second-generation ALK TKI chosen for superior CNS penetration following brain relapse.
extended.toxicity: Well tolerated. Mild myalgia (G1) and constipation.
extended.outcome: Initially cleared CNS disease. Recent breakthrough (Jan 2025) with new cerebellar lesion despite therapy.

report.findings: Incidental 1.2cm nodule RLL. Resected. ALK+ confirmed on IHC and FISH.
CT Chest/Abd: No evidence of disease. Patient asymptomatic.
MRI Brain: 2 parietal lesions (1.1cm, 0.9cm) with edema. CT Chest: Multiple miliary nodules.
MRI Brain: Parietal lesions reduced to <4mm calcifications. Lung nodules stable/smaller.
MRI Brain: New 8mm cerebellar lesion. Previous parietal lesions calcified. Extracranial disease stable.
report.plan: Refer for Stereotactic Radiosurgery (SRS). Continue Alectinib.

Name: Sarah Connor
History: Acute AST/ALT rise after last cycle.
Biology: Informational: HER2 overexpression is associated with sensitivity to HER2-directed antibody-drug conjugates.

extended.rationale: Standard 1L dual-blockade (Trastuzumab + Pertuzumab) with Taxane for de novo metastatic HER2+ disease.
extended.dosing: Docetaxel x 6 cycles -> HP Maintenance q3w.
extended.toxicity: G2 Neuropathy on Taxane (resolved). LVEF maintained >55% on maintenance.
extended.outcome: Progression in liver after 24 months of control.

extended.rationale: Next-generation ADC indicated for HER2+ metastatic breast cancer post-anti-HER2 therapy.
extended.toxicity: G2 Nausea (managed with Olanzapine). Recent AST/ALT elevation (Grade 2) under investigation.
extended.outcome: Robust Partial Response. Metabolic resolution of liver metastases.

report.findings: Palpable breast mass. CT: Multiple liver mets (Seg IV, V) and L2/L4 bone mets.
report.impression: De novo Stage IV HER2+ Breast Cancer.

report.findings: Chemotherapy (Docetaxel) completed. Liver lesions stable. Alopecia resolving.
report.plan: Echo q3 months to monitor LVEF.

report.findings: CT Abdomen: Liver lesions increased in size (2cm -> 3.5cm). New satellite lesions.
Liver lesions reduced by 30%. Patient reports nausea G2.
PET Scan: Complete metabolic resolution of liver lesions. Bone mets sclerotic.

Name: Sarah Smith
Biology: Informational: Triple Negative phenotype is associated with high recurrence risk and cytotoxic sensitivity.

extended.rationale: Adjuvant curative-intent chemotherapy for Stage I TNBC.
extended.dosing: Dose Dense AC x 4 -> Paclitaxel x 4.
extended.toxicity: Completed as planned. G2 Alopecia, G1 Neuropathy.
extended.outcome: Clinical CR at completion. Relapsed within 6 months of finishing.

extended.rationale: Palliative systemic therapy for metastatic recurrence.
extended.toxicity: Hand-Foot Syndrome Grade 2 requiring dose interruption.
extended.outcome: Primary Refractory. Progression in lungs and liver after only 3 cycles.

report.findings: Lumpectomy bed clean. Nodes 0/14. ER/PR/HER2 Negative.
Mammogram: negative. Physical exam normal.
CT Chest/Abd: Multiple cannonball lung mets. Liver capsular implants. Biopsy confirms TNBC recurrence.
Grade 2 Palmar-Plantar Erythrodysesthesia. Painful walking.
report.plan: Dose reduce Capecitabine by 25%. Topical urea cream.

report.findings: >20% increase in sum of diameters of lung lesions. New moderate pleural effusion.
report.impression: Progression on Capecitabine. PIK3CA mutation detected in liquid biopsy.
report.plan: Evaluate for clinical trial or Sacituzumab Govitecan.

Name: Walter White
History: Pending current quarter CT imaging results.
Biology: Informational: KRAS mutations are associated with intrinsic resistance to anti-EGFR therapies.

extended.rationale: Standard 1L doublet + VEGF inhibitor for RAS-mutant mCRC.
extended.dosing: mFOLFOX6 + Bevacizumab 5mg/kg q2w. Oxaliplatin dropped after cycle 8.
extended.toxicity: Oxaliplatin-induced neuropathy (Grade 2) persisting in fingertips. HTN controlled on meds.
extended.outcome: Stable Disease. Currently on 5-FU/Bevacizumab maintenance phase.

report.findings: Obstructing sigmoid mass. Urgent Hemicolectomy. 4/15 lymph nodes positive.
Baseline staging CT reveals 2 hypodense lesions in liver Seg VI/VII, confirmed MRI.
report.impression: Synchronous Metastatic Disease (Stage IV). KRAS G12V detected.

report.findings: Peripheral neuropathy G2 (buttoning shirts difficult). Liver lesions stable/calcified.
Disease stable. CEA slowly creeping but imaging stable.
Physical exam unremarkable. Neuropathy G2 (fingertips). CEA stable at 15.4.
report.plan: Hold Oxaliplatin. Continue 5-FU/Bev maintenance. Chase CT scan results.

Name: Jesse Pinkman
History: Sustained NED status as of Jan 2025.
Biology: Informational: MSI-High and high TMB are biological drivers associated with exceptional IO response.

extended.toxicity: Excellent tolerance. No immune-mediated adverse events (Grade 0).
extended.outcome: Complete Radiological Response confirmed June 2024. Sustained NED.

report.findings: Young onset. Extensive peritoneal carcinomatosis. Primary Right Colon. IHC: MLH1/PMS2 Absent.
Abdominal pain resolved. CT: Significant regression of peritoneal omental cake.
CT Chest/Abd/Pelvis: Complete resolution of peritoneal implants. Normalization of bowel wall thickening.
No new complaints. Imaging remains clear.
PET/CT: No hypermetabolic activity. CEA 1.2.

Name: Skyler White
Biology: Informational: Early stage disease (T1) without drivers has a favorable surgical prognosis.

extended.rationale: Definitive surgical management for Stage IA NSCLC.
extended.toxicity: Post-operative atelectasis (resolved). Chronic mild intercostal neuralgia.
extended.outcome: R0 Resection (Negative Margins). No adjuvant therapy required.

report.findings: LDCT Screening: 1.8cm RML nodule. PET avid. Brain MRI negative.
TTF-1 Positive Adenocarcinoma.
RML Lobectomy + Node dissection. Margins negative. Path: Adenocarcinoma, minimally invasive.
Post-surgical changes RML. No nodules. No lymphadenopathy.
Breath sounds clear. Incision healed. Mild post-op fatigue.

Name: Gustavo Fring
History: Critical CEA spike from 40 to 245 since Sep 2024.
New bone lesions identified on 2025-01-04 imaging.
Biology: Informational: BRAF V600E mutations are associated with aggressive disease and rapid progression.

extended.rationale: Adjuvant therapy turned palliative upon recurrence.
extended.toxicity: Grade 3 Neutropenia requiring G-CSF. G2 Fatigue.
extended.outcome: Disease progression in liver and lungs.

extended.rationale: BEACON regimen: Standard 2L for BRAF V600E mutant mCRC.
extended.outcome: Rapid failure. Explosive CEA rise and new bone metastases.

report.findings: Colonoscopy: Obstructing mass. BRAF V600E confirmed.
Recurrence in peritoneum. Started FOLFOX.
CT: Multiple liver metastases and bilateral lung nodules. CEA rose 5 -> 40.
Primary refractory disease. CEA doubling time < 4 weeks. Rash G3.
Bone Scan: Diffuse uptake in lumbar spine/pelvis. CEA 245. Cr 1.4.
report.plan: Hospice referral / Best Supportive Care discussion.

Name: Hank Schrader
Biology: Informational: High ER/PR expression in male breast cancer is associated with hormone-therapy response.

extended.rationale: Standard hormonal therapy for ER+ Male Breast Cancer.
extended.outcome: Stable Disease. Bone lesions controlled with concurrent RT.

report.findings: Left Mastectomy. 2.5cm IDC. 1/14 nodes.
Well healed scar. No nodes palpable.
Patient reported rib pain. Bone scan: Solitary uptake Left 5th rib. No visceral disease.
RT course completed. Pain improving.
Pain resolved (0/10). No new complaints. PSA 1.2 (Normal).
